science_fiction.name: Dune
science_fiction.description: A sweeping epic set on the desert planet of Arrakis, where noble families fight for control of a valuable resource known as 'spice'.

science_fiction.name: Neuromancer
science_fiction.description: A cyberpunk classic by William Gibson that introduces the concept of 'cyberspace' and follows a washed-up computer hacker on a high-tech heist.

science_fiction.name: The Left Hand of Darkness
science_fiction.description: In Ursula K. Le Guin's masterpiece, a human envoy journeys to a distant planet where inhabitants change gender, challenging ideas about identity and society.

science_fiction.name: The Martian
science_fiction.description: Mark Watney, an astronaut stranded on Mars, must use his ingenuity and knowledge to survive as he faces seemingly insurmountable odds.

science_fiction.name: Hyperion
science_fiction.description: Dan Simmons' epic sci-fi tale of seven pilgrims who travel to a distant planet, each with their own unique story tied to the mysterious Shrike creature.

science_fiction.name: The Three-Body Problem
science_fiction.description: Cixin Liu's Hugo Award-winning novel that explores first contact with an alien civilization and the ensuing existential crises and political upheaval.

science_fiction.name: The Forever War
science_fiction.description: Joe Haldeman's military science fiction novel that tells the story of soldiers sent to fight an alien enemy, only to return to a radically different world.

science_fiction.name: Ready Player One
science_fiction.description: In a dystopian future, a teenager embarks on a quest within a virtual reality world to find an Easter egg hidden by its late creator, hoping for wealth and power.

science_fiction.name: Snow Crash
science_fiction.description: A fast-paced cyberpunk novel by Neal Stephenson that mixes virtual reality with ancient Sumerian mythology, creating a unique narrative about the future of the internet.

science_fiction.name: Altered Carbon
science_fiction.description: In Richard K. Morgan's novel, humanity has discovered how to transfer consciousness into new bodies, leading to a futuristic world of immortality, crime, and mystery.

science_fiction.name: Brave New World
science_fiction.description: A dystopian classic by Aldous Huxley, where a futuristic society achieves apparent happiness through genetic engineering and state control, but at the cost of individual freedom.

science_fiction.name: The Dispossessed
science_fiction.description: Ursula K. Le Guin explores the lives of two societies—one capitalist and one anarchist—on two different planets in her exploration of social and political systems.

science_fiction.name: Foundation
science_fiction.description: Isaac Asimov's landmark series follows the efforts of a group of scientists to preserve knowledge and civilization as a galactic empire collapses.

science_fiction.name: I, Robot
science_fiction.description: A collection of short stories by Isaac Asimov exploring the interaction between humans and robots, focusing on moral dilemmas and the Three Laws of Robotics.

science_fiction.name: The Windup Girl
science_fiction.description: In a future of genetic engineering and bio-terrorism, a corporate 'windup girl' becomes the key to unraveling a conspiracy that could reshape the world.

science_fiction.name: The Handmaid's Tale
science_fiction.description: Margaret Atwood's dystopian novel set in a future totalitarian society where women are stripped of their rights, focusing on one woman's struggle for survival and autonomy.

science_fiction.name: Starship Troopers
science_fiction.description: Robert A. Heinlein's military science fiction novel follows the experiences of a soldier in a future interstellar war between humans and insect-like aliens.

science_fiction.name: The Stars My Destination
science_fiction.description: Alfred Bester's hard-hitting science fiction novel follows a vengeful man on a quest for power, set against the backdrop of a vast, interstellar society.

science_fiction.name: The Quantum Thief
science_fiction.description: Hannu Rajaniemi's novel blends quantum mechanics and futuristic heist elements in a high-tech world where a master thief tries to recover his memories.
